subsc: General public administration sector,Micro- and SME finance,Agricultural extension and research,Water supply,General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will implement the
            Government's strategy for natural resource management
            in dryland areas.  The main purpose of the project is to
            break the cycle of natural resource degradation and poverty
            by providing support for improved natural resource
            management approaches and practices, coupled with
            agricultural development.  The project is designed to assist
            the population in making the best use of the limited natural
            resources available.  The project consists of four
            components.  The first component is natural resource
            management which aims to conserve the water, land and
            vegetation in the area. This component focuses on the
            effective utilization of surface water flow, through
            watershed management on about 6000 feddans (2520 ha) and
            water harvesting, and on the management and sustainable use
            of land and vegetative cover by the local population and
            their small livestock.  A second component is adaptive
            research and extension which focuses on dryland farming and
            livestock production systems, range management, sustainable
            agricultural development and training directed to local
            communities.  A third component is rural finance which gives
            special attention to the promotion of on-farm and off-farm
            income-generating activities targeted to small farmers, the
            landless and rural women. Lastly, a project coordination
            unit component, aims at strenghtening community
            participation and the dialogue with existing local institutions.
